description: This crash occurred on a two-way, two-lane roadway. It was not physically divided, and had a traffic-control device, for a construction zone.  The conditions were as follows: early afternoon, clear skies, the roadway was dry and there were no atmospheric conditions.  The gradient for the two vehicles involved were both on a +6% roadway.  The posted speed limit for vehicle one (V1) and vehicle two (V2) was 64 kph (40 mph). V2 was a 2005 Mercury Sable was traveling northbound and was stopped for a stop/slow sign for the construction zone.  Upon realization of the impending crash, the driver of V2 stated that he could not do anything.  V1 was a 2002 Dodge Neon, traveling northbound.  V1 struck V2 in the center part of V2's rear bumper.  The impact caused V1 to push V2 up the roadway.  V1 and V2 came to final rest in the roadway.  V1 was towed due to damage.  V2 was able to be driven from the scene.I spoke to the construction worker on scene, which was holding the stop sign.  He was only able to give a few words, due to the language barrier.  He attested that V2 was waiting for the sign to change, so V2 could proceed.  He further stated that V1 pushed V2 up the roadway some.

This crash occurred on a two lane undivided roadway, slightly curving to the right prior to the crash site, with no grade and a posted speed limit of  72 KMPH (45 MPH). The weather was clear and the roadway was dry. This crash occurred on a weekday afternoon.Vehicle #1, a 1998 Honda Accord, was traveling north on the two lane undivided roadway when it stopped to allow several  southbound vehicles  to pass before proceeding to make an intended left turn onto a side road. Vehicle #2, a 1994 Ford Escort LX, was traveling in the same direction behind Vehicle #1. Vehicle #2 impacted the rear of Vehicle #1 with it's front. Both vehicles came to rest in the roadway facing north.The Honda Accord (Vehicle #1) was driven by a belted  37 year old female who was transported to an area hospital, treated and released, with a complaint of pain to her neck.  She stated that she was stopped, waiting for the on coming traffic to clear before she made her left turn.  Just as she glanced at her rear view mirror she saw Vehicle #2 coming at her fast.  The driver of Vehicle #2 was not slowing down and then she heard brakes and she gripped the steering wheel, and then she was hit from behind.  The driver of this vehicle was wearing prescription contacts at the time of the crash.  Vehicle #1 was driven from the scene.

The crash occurred in the intersection of a five-lane roadway with a traffic control signal.  Conditions were daylight with snow and slush on the roadway at 1:06 pm on a Monday afternoon.  The roadway had a posted speed of 50 MPH and the northbound lane had a positive 3% grade.      V1 was a 1998 Toyota Camry sedan intending on going straight thru the intersection with a green light in the southbound lane.  V2 was a 1994 Dodge Intrepid sedan intending on turning left at the same intersection with a green light.  V2 was in the northbound lane.  As V2 was turning left, the front of V2 struck the left side of V1.  V1 continued on and the front right corner struck a guardrail, coming to final rest.  V2 came to final rest in the center of the intersection-heading north.      A 34-year-old male who was transported drove V1 and was transported to a local hospital with minor injuries.  He stated that he was going straight in the southbound lane and he saw the other vehicle turning in front of him.  He was unable to take any avoidance actions.  V1 continued straight and the front of V1 rested against a guardrail.  The driver of V1 was traveling at 50 MPH at the time of impact.  V1 was towed due to damage and had a CDC of 10LYEW1.
